summary: What about peter having an older sister?
question: What about peter having an older sister?
answer:
• Oh dude peter having an older sister would be sarcasm city.
  • she definitely found out about Spider-Man due to being observant
  • And she’s always having to cover for him when may got suspicious
  • She goes off to college and peter thinks he’s going to have a mental break down because he’s never been anywhere without her
  • But he’s still really protective over her and when she brings her boyfriend home,, ohno
  • Peter would spend half the night glaring at him
  • But in reality he’s just scared he won’t get to spend as much time with his older sister
  • They bicker a lot, like normal siblings
  • When he doesn’t come back from the infinity war she’s absolutely distraught
  • And she wishes that she could have convinced him not to
  • Because it wouldn’t be the first time she’s had to stop him from doing something stupid
  • She has to spend most of the time making sure aunt may is okay but on reality, she needs her baby brother
  • Peter and his older sister = the best duo around

If you want me to write a ficlet you can prompt me :D

Main blog / AO3

I'm a broke writer. If you like my stuff, buy me a coffee?

Buy me a coffee

summary: All|Clint. Clint is somehow involved in the rescue of all the Avengers: in addition Natasha and Thor, he found Steve in Arctic...
question: All|Clint. Clint is somehow involved in the rescue of all the Avengers: in addition Natasha and Thor, he found Steve in Arctic and Tony in Afghanistan; helped Bruce to escape from  radars, but never told about it. And Avengers accidentally knew about it. Thanks for all your works)
answer:
“Huh,” Tony said and leaned back. He frowned at the screen and pursed his lips. He sat on the couch in his living room, a StarkPad in his hand and his feet on the coffee table.

“What’s wrong?” Pepper asked and came over to him. “Something with the Mraez-Deal?”

“No, no,” he said. “That’s sewn up and all fine.” He looked at her and saw her leaning over his shoulder and looking at the StarkPad, too. “I just… Remember all the stuff Natasha dumped in the Internet a few weeks ago?”

Pepper nodded and walked around the couch to sit beside him. He gave her the StarkPad.

“I got a copy before SHIELD managed to remove the data again. And I just had the time to go through a few of them.”

“A few of them?” Pepper raised a brow and Tony shrugged.

“Okay, the stuff about the Avengers, about us,” he admitted then. “What? I’m curious, you know that.”

“Did I say a word?” Pepper asked and Tony shrugged again.

“I know your expressions,” he said and then pointed at the StarkPad. “Start the video.”

Pepper did and saw lots of soldiers, the Hulk and… civilians.

“A few students filmed this when Hulk had his… well… appearance at Culver University.” The video showed Hulk fighting, the soldiers trying to stop him and then Tony reached over and stopped it.

“Okay, and now check this out,” he said and pointed at one of the military vehicles. “What do you see here?”

“Soldiers,” Pepper said and turned to Tony, a frown on her face.

“No, look closer,” Tony said and pointed again.

“One of them has a weird weapon,” she said. “It looks like… a bow?” She looked up again. “Is that Agent Barton?”

“According to Jarvis, yes,” Tony said. He took the StarkPad, typed and then gave it back to Pepper. “Look at this.”

There were photos from the mission where they found Steve in the ice. Tony had seen a few of them but some were classified. Now he had them.

“Look,” he said and pointed at one of the pictures. “The guy, who’s talking with Coulson.”

“Agent Barton,” Pepper said and Tony nodded.

“Agent Barton,” he confirmed. Once again he took the Pad, typed and gave it back. A video started to play and showed two helicopters flying over a desert.

“Oh, that’s Rhodey,” Pepper said and then her head snapped over to him. “Is that…”

“Afghanistan,” Tony said quietly. “But… look at the pilot. Wait… now you can see his face.”

“Oh my god, that’s Barton, too,” she whispered.

Tony showed her more pictures about a secret facility somewhere in another desert. And there was a guy with a bow, too.

“That’s where Thor’s hammer landed on Earth,” Tony said. “And look at him, he’s been there as well.”

“Did you know about this?” Pepper asked and gestured at the facility SHIELD had built in the desert.

“No,” Tony shook his head. “Only what Thor told us.”

“And Agent Barton has met all of you before you were the Avengers,” Pepper said slowly. “But… why?”

“Because I had orders,” a voice behind them said and Tony startled so violently, he dropped the StarkPad.

“Dammit! Man with a heart condition here,” he grumbled when Clint came into his view. “How did you get in, I didn’t hear the elevator?”

Clint grinned and went to one of the armchairs to sit down. “I’m a professional,” he winked. “And Jarvis called me and said you wanted to talk to me.”

“Yeah… uh…” Tony looked at Pepper. She sighed, rolled her eyes and patted his knee. Both men waited till she was in the elevator.

“You forgot Natasha,” Clint said. “I recruited her a few years ago.”

“You met all of us before we even were Avengers,” Tony said. “That’s not a coincidence, isn’t it?”

Clint looked at his hands for a moment before he shrugged.

“No,” he said then. “Fury… he trusts my judgement. And my eyes.”

“Your eyes?” Tony furrowed his brows.

“I see things people want to hide,” Clint smiled. “And he asked me for my opinion on a few interesting candidates for the Avengers Initiative.”

“So… you checked us out?” Tony asked. He folded his arms over his chest when Clint nodded.

“Yeah, pretty much,” Clint admitted bluntly.

“And no one of the others knows?” Tony asked. Clint shrugged again.

“Nat knows,” he said. “Steve knows and… I think Bruce knows, too. Well, and you know now.”

“Why didn’t you tell me?” Tony asked and Clint shrugged. “You should’ve told us.”

“Yeah, maybe,” Clint said and rose. “I have to go back now, tormenting junior agents,” he added and waggled his brows.

Tony followed him with his eyes but before he could enter the elevator, he turned back to him. “Oh, and just for the record,” he said. “I recommended you to become an Avenger. I thought you’d be good for the team. It was Coulson who was against it.” He entered the elevator, pressed a button and the doors went shut. Clint had recommended him. And Tony smiled.

blog.description: This blog is an automated list of the stories posted on Archive Of Our Own under the Tony Stark tag. The stories are automatically posted here from the AO3 RSS feed.

summary: The Futurist
title: The Futurist
body:
read it on the AO3 at http://bit.ly/2GtPgYi

by Illiteracy_is_for_woozles

Stark Family Movie Night. It doesn’t end the way they were planning.

Words: 1913, Chapters: ½, Language: English

Series: Part 10 of The Future Is History

  • Fandoms: Iron Man (Movies), The Avengers (Marvel Movies), Marvel Cinematic Universe
  • Rating: General Audiences
  • Warnings: No Archive Warnings Apply
  • Categories: F/M, Gen
  • Characters: Tony Stark, Pepper Potts, Peter Parker, Original Male Character(s), Original Female Character(s)
  • Relationships: Pepper Potts/Tony Stark
  • Additional Tags: Mutant Powers, Mutant Politics, Baby Mutants, Movie Night, Big Hero 6 Spoilers, Big Hero 6 (2014) References, Clairvoyance, Psychic Abilities, Parent Tony Stark, Protective Tony Stark, Peter Parker is Tony Stark’s Biological Child, Family Bonding, Family Dynamics, Family, inventing, Laboratories, Lab Accidents, Politics, Mutant Rights, Tony Stark is Good With Kids, Tony Stark Has A Heart, BAMF Pepper Potts, Parent Pepper Potts, Protective Pepper Potts, Awesome Pepper Potts, office politics, Business Deals, Morality, Dubious Morality, Moral Bankruptcy, Deception, Deceit


read it on the AO3 at http://bit.ly/2GtPgYi

blog.name: strangemischief
blog.title: What Strange Trickery This Is
blog.description: Ironstrange + Supremefamily | Occasional Thor or Loki Content | Side Blog | Tag List | Ao3

summary: The beloved Sherlock au the ironstrange discord was talking about
question: The beloved Sherlock au the ironstrange discord was talking about
answer:
This prompt confirms my fear that everyone knows I’m silently lurking on the server all the time. Also, I’m basing it more off the video that was linked since I’ve watched it more times than I care to admit. 

1. Quick Recap: Tony and Stephen both lived as Sherlock Holmes during a past life where they were mystery-solving roommates and lovers. Flash-forward to the MCU as we know it and Stephen Strange stumbles across Tony Stark and slowly realizes Tony is his love from a past life, just as Thanos threatens to destroy them all.

2. At first, his main priorities are the same: protect the stone and defeat Thanos. But then the flashes of his past life occur more frequently. When he looks forward to the future, images of the past interlace the coming possibilities. Stephen’s entire mindset shifts, and soon he no longer sees himself having lived two distinct and different lives. Rather, it’s one long, continuous life that weaves around Tony’s in an intricate dance across time. 

3. There is an attachment that felt alien and yet…right. Time seems obsolete, the pains of this life minor, and Thanos but a slight inconvenience in a much larger picture. And despite being on a barren planet with three strangers, a kid, and the threat of demise handing of his head, all Stephen can feel is overwhelming joy. But then Thanos arrives, and Stephen watches from the rocks as Tony’s own blade is driven into his side. 

4. Stephen only meant to reverse time once. Just one time. He understood the repercussions of playing with time, but…surely just once could do no harm. But then Thanos burnt Tony alive, and Stephen had to try again. Tony was blasted out of the sky and hit the rocky ground of Titan in a sea of scarlet and Stephen had no choice but to draw on the Time Stone’s power. Tony died in a morbid cycle of death and despair as Stephen went further and further back in time, trapping himself in an uncontrollable spiral of scattered time in his desperate search to find one timeline, one sliver of a moment, where he and Tony found happiness. 

5. And the hardest part? It isn’t watching Tony die. It’s not when Stephen realizes that he’s been consumed by time. No, the hardest part is when Stephen finally recognizes this was all there ever was; this was all it could ever be. Stephen could never win this battle. He could only lose. Again, and again, and again, and again. 

Forever. 

And he was willing to – if only to see Tony alive. Just…one…more…time.

Send me an AU and I’ll tell you 5 HCs.

summary:
The Futurist, my Iron Man ficlet, has been started. There
 are only two chapters two this and the second one will be up...
body:
The Futurist, my Iron Man ficlet, has been started.

There are only two chapters two this and the second one will be up tomorrow, then after that the Banner and Hulk story will be up. (There’s a whole chapter that’s mostly the Hulk’s POV!!!)

I’m currently writing that surprise ficlet I mentioned yesterday and I hope to have it finished by tomorrow if I can. (Please, someone send some support my way? I’m scared of messing this one up)

Not if you keep giving my fiance aneurysms

>>>Spidey @spidermaam

:(

blog.name: theoncomingeastwindstormer-1027
blog.title: Just Me
blog.description: Random rants about several fandoms and my boring life

summary: Tony
title: Tony
body:
I feel like nobody is talking about how terrifying it is for Tony to be stranded in space running out of air. He has PTSD from the first time he was in space and yet when the world needed him to go back out there he didn’t hesitate. He was certain he’d die that time, and he was certain he’d die this time too because he told Peter it’s a one way ticket. 

And now he knows he doesn’t stand a chance, but we know he does, we know he comes back. When he does though, how will he cope with the panic attacks starting up again? How will he cope with the nightmares of watching everyone turn to dust? 

He must be so afraid that he’s going to die as soon as the air runs out, but that little spark of hope that tells him he’ll make it must be far more terrifying, because then he has to live with everything that’s happened, and how does he do that?
